intro: Eriogonum brevicaule var. mitophyllum, commonly known as the shortleaf buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has basal leaves that are short and rounded, and its stems are often hairy. This species is often found in open areas such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe.
